progress.note: Completed: Research React, Angular, and Vue.js frameworks to document their pros, cons, learning curves, and use cases.

next_steps.note: Research and compare 3 popular JavaScript web development frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js), documenting their pros/cons, learning curves, and use cases.
Set up a basic development environment (Node.js, npm/yarn, code editor) and create a 'Hello World' project using the framework chosen in step 1.
Define 3 simple project ideas that could be built using the chosen framework, each progressively increasing in complexity (e.g., To-Do List, Simple Calculator, Basic Form with Validation).
Begin building the simplest project idea (e.g., To-Do List) â€“ focus on core functionality (adding, deleting items) and commit code frequently to a Git repository.
Document the initial setup process and any encountered issues, creating a README file for the project's Git repository.
Synthesize research findings into a comparative table outlining the pros, cons, learning curves, and typical use cases for React, Angular, and Vue.js.
Identify a simple web application (e.g., to-do list, basic calculator) suitable for building a proof-of-concept in each framework.
Begin building the proof-of-concept application in React, focusing on component structure and data flow.
Document the initial React proof-of-concept build, noting any immediate challenges or benefits observed compared to research findings.
Research and document state management solutions for each framework (React: Redux/Context, Angular: RxJS, Vue: Vuex/Pinia) and their suitability for different application complexities.
